strategy: Implement an ensemble learning approach using Random Forest Regressor in combination with Gradient Boosting Regressor.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor, GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Define models
rf_model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
gb_model = GradientBoostingRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)

# Train models
rf_model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)
gb_model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_rf = rf_model.predict(X_train_scaled)
y_pred_gb = gb_model.predict(X_train_scaled)

# Combine predictions
y_pred_combined = 0.7 * y_pred_rf + 0.3 * y_pred_gb

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = mean_squared_error(y_train, y_pred_combined, squared=False)
print(f"RMSE: {rmse}")

# Make predictions on test set
test_predictions = 0.7 * rf_model.predict(X_test_scaled) + 0.3 * gb_model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': test_predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor, GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)
X_test.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Separate numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Define preprocessing steps
numeric_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
    ('scaler', StandardScaler())
])

categorical_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
    ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'))
])

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numeric_transformer, numerical_features),
        ('cat', categorical_transformer, categorical_features)
    ])

# Define models
rf_model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
gb_model = GradientBoostingRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)

# Create pipelines
pipeline_rf = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor), ('model', rf_model)])
pipeline_gb = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor), ('model', gb_model)])

# Train models
pipeline_rf.fit(X_train, y_train)
pipeline_gb.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_pred_rf = pipeline_rf.predict(X_train)
y_pred_gb = pipeline_gb.predict(X_train)

# Combine predictions
y_pred_combined = 0.7 * y_pred_rf + 0.3 * y_pred_gb

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = m

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor, GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer

# Load data

test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data

X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

X_test = imputer.transform(X_test)

categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

    ('scaler', StandardScaler())
])

categorical_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
    ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore'))
])

preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numeric_transformer, numerical_features),
        ('cat', categorical_transformer, categorical_features)
    ])

# Define models

gb_model = GradientBoostingRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)

# Create pipelines

pipeline_gb = Pipeline(steps=[('preprocessor', preprocessor), ('model', gb_model)])

# Train models

pipeline_gb.fit(X_train, y_train)

y_pred_gb = pipeline_gb.predict(X_train)

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor, GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Preprocess data
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']
X_train = train_data.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_data.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
imputer_num = SimpleImputer(strategy='mean')
imputer_cat = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')

X_train_num = imputer_num.fit_transform(X_train[X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns])
X_test_num = imputer_num.transform(X_test[X_test.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns])

X_train_cat = imputer_cat.fit_transform(X_train[X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns])
X_test_cat = imputer_cat.transform(X_test[X_test.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns])

X_train = pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(X_train_num, columns=X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns), 
                     pd.DataFrame(X_train_cat, columns=X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns)], axis=1)

X_test = pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(X_test_num, columns=X_test.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns), 
                    pd.DataFrame(X_test_cat, columns=X_test.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns)], axis=1)

# Separate numerical and categorical features
numerical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns.tolist()
categorical_features = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Define preprocessing steps
numeric_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
    ('scaler', StandardScaler())
])
